Description: Calcite (alabaster) vase with tall foot, golbular body, and a high, cylindircal neck and external ledge-rim.
Curator's comments: On New Kingdom stone vessels, see Egypt’s Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982): 126-32. An example similar to EA 4555 was found in an 18th dynasty tomb at Sedment (Petrie & Brunton, Sedment II, pl.LVII [254]) along with two cosmetic boxes, calcite kohl-pots, and ceramic vessels.
